playwright.name: Playwright Browser Validation
playwright.description: Run browser-based flow checks and UI validation to support UX quality and implementation verification

capabilities.flow_execution: Execute user journey steps in browser
capabilities.keyboard_checks: Test keyboard navigation and focus order
capabilities.evidence: Capture artifacts for handoff and QA

when_to_use: Task Manager defining executable acceptance checks
Verifying empty/error/loading states are reachable and usable
example_queries: Run a login flow and verify error handling on invalid credentials
Validate keyboard navigation across primary dashboard controls
Check that loading and empty states appear correctly on task list
Capture smoke evidence for top 3 user journeys

agent_instructions.activation: Use when flow-level UX validation needs real browser behavior, not only static review.
agent_instructions.usage: Run focused journey checks and convert failures into concrete story tasks or defects.
agent_instructions.integration: Reference outcomes in handoff-checklist.md and implementation-readiness.md.

how_to_use.for_agents: Use this MCP to validate actual interaction behavior and strengthen acceptance criteria quality.
how_to_use.for_humans: Install and configure when browser-level flow verification is needed in your agent workflow.
setup_instructions: Install Playwright MCP server package or run via npx
notes: If your environment uses a different Playwright MCP package name, update the command/args accordingly.
Use headless mode for CI and full mode for local UX debugging.
